page.title: 08A WALK AROUND NAUNTON FARM
page.content: The land to the Naunton Farm side of the B4078 particularly those coming down to the road contained crops of ripening wheat. Two smaller fields contained broad beans. Cows were grazing on the meadows around the farm itself. New poplar trees had been planted on the S.E. side of the lane running up to the farm. The farm has two, new barns of metal construction. There are several areas of uncultivated woodland which no doubt supported wildlife other than the birds and rabbits which were seen. On the opposite side of the road from the farmthere is a sawmill which had new buildings and an air of prosperity. However, in contrast the area round the filling station looked very untidy and run down. A new gaspipe was being laid making an ugly gash right across the landscape.
